content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Score A has one staff in the treble clef. There is no key signature or time signature and the score has only one measure consisting of a single homophonic chord of two whole notes. The pitches in score A are: a chord of A4 and C sharp 5.

Score B has one staff in the treble clef. There is no key signature or time signature and the score has only one measure consisting of a single homophonic chord of two whole notes. The pitches in score B are: a chord of A4 and D5.

Score C has one staff in the treble clef. There is no key signature or time signature and the score has only one measure consisting of a single homophonic chord of two whole notes. The pitches in score C are: a chord of A4 and D sharp 5.

Score D has one staff in the treble clef. There is no key signature or time signature and the score has only one measure consisting of a single homophonic chord of two whole notes. The pitches in score D are: a chord of A4 and E5.

content.answer: Score C has one staff in the treble clef. There is no key signature or time signature and the score has only one measure consisting of a single homophonic chord of two whole notes. The pitches in score C are: a chord of A4 and D sharp 5.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
